title.native: ダンジョンに出会いを求めるのは間違っているだろうか ─ オリオンの矢 ─
title.romaji: Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka: Orion no Ya
title.english: Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?: Arrow of the Orion

description:
Living above the legendary dungeons of Orario ought to be enough danger for anyone, and in his short time as a member of the goddess Hestia's familia, Bell Cranel has experienced more perils and pitfalls than most. So, when Bell unexpectedly wins a free trip, is it too much to hope that he might have actually won a real vacation? Of course it is! Inexplicably chosen as the champion of Hestia's friend, the goddess Artemis, Bell quickly finds himself up to his neck in ruins and monsters as yet another epic quest begins. And where Bell goes, can the ever-jealous Hestia be far behind?

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujinoomori)

Fujino Oomori is a Japanese author most known for writing the [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) light novel series. 

In early 2013, [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) was submitted to the 4th GA Bunko Award, where it won and received an offer to have it published by Bunko.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzupin) | [Tumblr](https://suzupin.tumblr.com/)

Yasuda began drawing when he was 19 years old, after being inspired by [Range Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/98445/Range-Murata)'s pictures. As an illustrator he usually works with novels, providing the cover art and illustrations. He also makes logo designs for companies and games.  He also works on Range Murata's Robot, where he did the chapters: "Ebony & Ivory (Volume 1 & 2)" and "Minus R (Volume 4)"; despite having different names they are part of the same storyline.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Sakurabi made his directional debut with [Gunparade March](https://anilist.co/anime/266/). He is a fan of simple and refreshing love stories. As a director he's known for modifying original stories a lot, which has brought him substantial amounts of critique. He is quite infamous for his work as the director of the [Tsukihime](https://anilist.co/anime/169/) adaptation, with most fans disapproving of his changes from the original visual novel.

Amongst his most notable directorial works are [Yomigaeru Sora: Rescue Wings](https://anilist.co/anime/798/) and [Flying Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/21284/).

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. His drawing corrections as animation director are known for his advanced drawing skills. Additionally, he is occasionally entrusted with powerful character acting and action sequences.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujinoomori)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
Keiji Inai is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with the music production company IMAGINE.
Facebook Yuuta Takamura is a Japanese freelance director, episode director and storyboard artist.
